Reviews.Title: I'm Impressed
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: I've had the Droid Razr M for around a year and it's still kicking strong enough to hold up to my cousin's new GS3.Pro's-great screen size while still maintaining a compact size and a decent weight (I like a bit more weight to show durability); the on-screen buttons keep the phone looking beautiful while off; the camera isn't fancy enough for pro photography but it is good enough for family events or landscape scenes; durability is unmatched with a Kevlar back, the gorilla glass front screen, and a stainless steel rimmed edging, even after repeatedly dropping it from my full height at chest level (~5'7") it has only 2 dings in the metal and the back glass is still perfect; bright LED notification light; almost stock Android; circles widget is convenient; speaker is loud without audio being distorted; runs everything that I need it to run and crashes almost no apps at all; splash-proof hardware makes it fine to use in the shower (out of the spray) and safe to keep in the steam for a few hours on end.Con's-button placement is awkward with the power button and volume rocker on the same side; the charging port placement isn't the most convenient (on the bottom left is kinda weird); software could lag slightly while running more than 3 applications at the same time; there isn't a removable battery; bloatware is abundant; doesn't support a 64 gb memory stick; lock screen could use some work.The cons are obviously almost all a preference to myself. It's mostly what you prefer but i give it a 4 out of 5 because the cons are something easy to get around but do not go unnoticed.

Reviews.Title: Great phone at a great price, delivered quickly.
Reviews.Author: Tom "Tommy J"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to keep my unlimited data plan with Verizon, so I didn't want to get stuck into a new 2 year contact and pay an extra $40 a month.  I got this phone, which was maybe$50/60 more than a flip phone.  It works great and it will pay for itself in 6 months.  I was able to swap out my old phone with this one on the Verizon site.  My contacts and apps all loaded up fine.Make sure you don't fall into the trap of upgrading your service while on the Verizon site.  They deliberately obscure the 'activate alternate phone' link during the process.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: M. Decker "deckm00"
Reviews.Content: I have had my corporate-issued Motorola Razr M for most of this year and for the most part I really like it.  Verizon 4G coverage in my neighborhood is pretty minimal (2 bars at best) and yet I can make and take calls easily.  Even video is continuous and clear (if I get closer to the windows).  I like the form factor, weight, screen size and resolution and especially image clarity.  Photos and video are very good.  I don't have a case and instead just throw it in my pocket. I'm not going to get into a Droid vs. IOS discussion here, they both have their pros and cons.  Not sure what the big deal is with the Kevlar rear surface though.  I mean it feels ok and I guess if I'm ever going to have to deflect a speeding bullet I'm ready for it but other than that I don't understand the point.  The battery can't be replaced but for me it's a non-issue (corporate will just issue me a new phone).  Bluetooth connectivity to both Hyundai and Bose headset works great.  The battery life was better at first and I guess is ok considering the technology.  It helps to turn off Wifi when not really needed.  I charge every night regardless and sometimes in the car if I've been talking alot.My Razr M pros and cons would be:Pros - size, weight, call clarity, screen resists scratching, durability (have dropped it a couple times onto hard flooring from ~3-4'), loud ringer, voice activated apps work well (especially the Google Maps Navigaton).Cons - the side on-off button is easy to hit by mistake, the speakerphone could be louder, I wish there was a physical on/off ringer button.  Would be nice if the charger port was on or near the top instead of the lower left side so that I could stand the phone up in my car's center console cubby space while charging.  Can't see the screen at all in bright daylight, you'll need to seek shade.

Reviews.Title: amazing customer service
Reviews.Author: Jacob Reames
Reviews.Content: The phone worked great, but then died.  Jason Evans, the QC supervisor of Simple Cell, immediately shipped another phone, and even refunded the expedited shipping charges.  He then emailed me a prepaid shipping label to send the old phone back. As for the  phone itself, I really like it, and it was a replacement for my stolen 'droid:  easy to use, Motorola has lots of online help.  And no shortage of apps!

Reviews.Title: dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Karen Hart
Reviews.Content: Phone screen stopped working after 1 ween. Not very happy at all. Total waste oh $170.00 dollars. Replacement guarantee available?

Reviews.Title: Great Android phone.  Don't know why Motorola phones have not sold well.
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Only one thing...  Would like longer battery life.  I would buy this again and recommend to friends and family.  Screen size perfect for my needs.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Anthony Petro
Reviews.Content: Phone is awesome, it has a great camera and the processor is really fast. The only thing I don't like is the short battery life when playing games.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Amanda Rose Willis
Reviews.Content: I really like this phone, a big step up from my 3yr old droid pro. The pictures it takes are simply amazing in their clarity.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: Patrick W. Knapp "Knapper"
Reviews.Content: For the most part the phone is great.  A couple quirks, such as the screen not auto rotating.  But for a $100 phone, I will learn to live with it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Robert John
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite phone I have owned of any Android to date. My first one I broke while working on my car and this particular one was well worth it. I waited for the price to drop because it was still pricey at the time or purchase. It performs the way I need it to and the Smart Actions App that it built in helps keep the battery going until the end of the day. I average about 20 hours of battery life. The size is comparable to the iPod Touch 4th and 5th Generations which I like because of it's size. Very happy that I have another XT907

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Emily Peiffer
Reviews.Content: The phone arrived way earlier than I expected - by 3 days, it works just fine so far. It can be a gamble with used phones online but it was described accurately. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: wmr
Reviews.Content: I read that these Verizon Global Ready worked on Straight Talk GSM AT&T; sims. It takes Radiocomm hack to stop blocking US GSM radio signal. It was real easy and I don't confess to have a lot of talent at tech. I purchased a AT&T; 4G LTE sims changed APN to the Straight Talk settings. It works prefect. You won't get LTE speeds with this set-up, just H+. To show the difference, my Straight Talk Verizon 3G fastest speed test was .7 mbps. This Razr M fastest is 7.5 mbps. I read some people say you can get 4G LTE. I have not. The wifi speed is FAST! I'm really happy with this and hope that I can update to Kit Kat. If you want a great phone for a pre-paid GSM network, I know this will work!

Reviews.Title: small than the droid razor white one i have
Reviews.Author: luis f
Reviews.Content: the phone is a bit smaller than the white droid razor m i have(stopped working) but never the less the phone works great so far,just like the white version (this one i got was black) i took the sim card out of the old one and put it in this one and it  activated it asap,i didnt even have to call verizon to activate it,its a good phone,need to it to last till jan 2015 when my contract ends,i hope it does

Reviews.Title: Battery Was Crap
Reviews.Author: Emily Stromquist
Reviews.Content: I love the model of this phone, but the one sent to me by this company only worked for 3 months.  The battery has been on a rapid decline since I first got it.  This morning it wouldn't turn on, so I plugged it in to the charger.  Within a couple minutes it was blazing hot...almost too hot to hold in my hand.  It still will not turn on.

Reviews.Title: Received late due to weather
Reviews.Author: Laurie Curley
Reviews.Content: I received phone without charging cord as pictured. I have another motorola droid charging cord that fits, so all is fine. The phone is in great shape.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: Reggie Reinhardt
Reviews.Content: Its an amazing phone. Barely any scratches. It works perfectly fine. I'm using it right now and the battery like isnt the best. But do able.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Carbajal
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the quality of the phone, just what I was hoping for. No complaints at all. very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Never thought I'd love a phone, but I do now.
Reviews.Author: Laura A. Velasquez
Reviews.Content: No point in going over all the features of this phone since specs and reviews exist. I must say I love it though. It's compact yet I'm able to text easily with it. I love that I can verbally ask Google a question and sometimes get a spoken response, otherwise I get a link.. I have dropped the phone once but it didn't shatter as another reviewer wrote. I did however have it in a case, one that is a belt clip holster that covers both sides of the phone.. Phone rings, I just slip it out of the holster easily. Link to holster is here on Amazon: B009RQ1M5KI recommend both the phone and the holster combo. Great sound too, sometimes I just plug in some headphones and listen to my albums in the Amazon cloud, although you can download them to the device. Some people complained about not getting an micro SD card to get recognized. You just have to power off the phone entirely, then insert the card, turn on the phone and you are good to go. Live wallpapers are fun too, one called Smoke is amazing. Okay I said I'd not talk about features but I've had this phone for several months now and love it. Fun apps too like Amazon price check. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Phone
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: I have had my Razr M for about a year now and have really enjoyed it. I chose it because I don't really like the trend of larger phones and thought that the size is just about perfect. Very comparable to an iPhone 4s along the lines of size and functionality at a fraction of the price. There was a little hiccup with the latest OTA update so I just loaded a custom ROM. If you don't know how to do that  or at least know someone who does, you should.

Reviews.Title: great phone for the money
Reviews.Author: noone
Reviews.Content: Plenty of after market support.  The Dev Edition allowed for easy unlocked boot loader and custom ROMS.Phone is perfect.

Reviews.Title: great phone for the money
Reviews.Author: noone
Reviews.Content: Plenty of after market support.  The Dev Edition allowed for easy unlocked boot loader and custom ROMS.Phone is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone that has still got it.
Reviews.Author: Daddyowl "MW"
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a dual core( snapdragon s4 processor)  phone and yes it only has a qhd display and still that display is a small 4.3 inches but still even in 2014 its a solid little phone, the edge to edge display is really very nice and it feels so good in the hand, tight lines, Kevlar backing and a very capable 8mp shooter. I love it and in may ways its in my top 3 phones of all time. As of now it will play any game out at close to 60 fps if not always 60 fps, in day to day tasks it performs as good as a quad core. Take it from me this phone will get you there and back again not only on looks but style as well.

Reviews.Title: Slow and unreliable
Reviews.Author: amari
Reviews.Content: I had this phone for a little over a year and it just bit the dust tonight. So I feel like it's time for this review.This was my first smartphone, and I liked it. The screen size was a huge pro, and it is pretty nice looking HD. Cameras weren't too bad either.However, the cons vastly outweigh the pros. From the get go, this phone is slow and laggy. It cannot handle even the basic task of bringing up the unlock screen without thinking about it for ages. I would try to play back music from the SD card I put in, and it would skip and stop and make awful sounds. It can't be hooked up natively/mounted as a USB device to a Mac computer, which is pretty much a necessity these days. It has okay battery life, depending on how much you use it and if the wifi is on.Since it's not a widely used phone, there isn't a lot of support for it. It held up against the occasional drop until it didn't--all its pixels went out in one fell swoop tonight. It also would overheat regularly, while charging and while not. Almost burned me a couple times.In short, thank goodness I bought this for 1 cent on Cyber Monday last year because any more would have been a crime.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Belinda
Reviews.Content: No rating at all .....I paid almost $200 for the phone and only last a month and half the phone went off I took it to my company for insurance cover and I have to paid another $100 ....I'm not will risk my money again..... first and last.....

Reviews.Title: Great product and company!
Reviews.Author: Megan Engler
Reviews.Content: This phone works like it is brand new! I even got the phone that was in "good" shape and it was absolutely perfect. Couldn't tell this from a brand new phone. Works great and no scratches! Would recommend this phone to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Great phone and price!
Reviews.Author: Mark Harnage
Reviews.Content: I have already had experience with one of these phones and now this second one has not failed to meet my expectations.

Reviews.Title: 0/10 would not reccomend
Reviews.Author: The Lion
Reviews.Content: Not actually unlocked and more damaged than was initially stated. Doesn't work internationally and was without a charger, which should have been included.

Reviews.Title: Don't believe the hype!
Reviews.Author: T. Person
Reviews.Content: We purchased this phone for our 13 year old son.  We were looking for a smart phone that was tough enough to handle the rigors of an active young man.  The Razr M looked to fit the bill.  It has gorilla glass on one side and carbon fiber on the other.  What's not to like about this?On the third day of his use, he was taking it out of his pocket and it slipped out of his hand.  After a 2.5 foot drop onto a hardwood floor, the gorilla glass shattered like it was thrown in a parking lot.  We couldn't believe it.  The rest of the phone is absolutely pristine, but the glass is shattered.When we went back to the Verizon store, we were told that the gorilla glass is really good for resisting scratches and such, but will shatter quite easily.  Something I wish they would have told us when we were purchasing the thing.So, if you're thinking of purchasing this phone, make certain that you also purchase the toughest case so the delicate "gorilla" glass doesn't shatter in the event you place it on the table too hard.
